# Extended Euclidean Algorithm
This program implements the extended euclidean algorithm,
finding the gcd and Bézout coefficients of two randomly
generated 4096-bit integers. It then compares this computed gcd
with the gcd generated using the GMU's library gcd function.

## Setup
This program has a reliance on gmp-6.1.2.
To properly download this on your enviorment, follow the guide found at https://linkevin.me/tutorial-installing-gmp-library-ubuntu/

## Usage 
To compile this program do either of the following,
``` Make```
or
```Make test```.

You can then run the code by typing: ```./EEA```.

To clean the code use
```Make clean```.

## Output
The following is sample output for this program: 

```
The two numbers we are finding the gcd of are:



and



The gcd from my Extended Euclidean Algorithm is: 562949953421312
The gcd from the GMU library function is: 562949953421312
These calculated gcd's are the same!

The Bezout coefficients are s:

-

and t:


 ```
